standards.description: Count to 100 by ones and by tens.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a counting sequence task. Ask the student to count by ones or tens up to 100.

standards.description: Count forward beginning from a given number within the known sequence within 100 (instead of having to begin at 1).
standards.prompt_guide: Provide a starting number between 1 and 90. Ask the student to count forward the next 5 numbers.

standards.description: Represent numbers. Write numbers from 0 to 20. Represent a number of objects with a written numeral 0-20.
standards.prompt_guide: Show a set of objects (like stars or apples) between 0 and 20. Ask the student to write the number that represents the count.

standards.description: Understand the relationship between numbers and quantities; connect counting to cardinality.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a task where the student must match a number to a specific quantity of items.

standards.description: Given a number from 1-20, count out that many objects.
standards.prompt_guide: Give the student a number (e.g., 7) and ask them to draw or circle that many items.

standards.description: Identify whether the number of objects in one group is greater than, less than, or equal to the number of objects in another group.
standards.prompt_guide: Show two groups of objects with different counts. Ask which group has more, less, or if they are equal.

standards.description: Compare two numbers between 1 and 10 presented as written numerals.
standards.prompt_guide: Provide two written numbers (e.g., 3 and 8). Ask the student to identify which is greater.

standards.description: Represent addition and subtraction with objects, fingers, mental images, drawings, sounds, acting out situations, verbal explanations, expressions, or equations.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a simple story problem that can be solved by drawing a picture of addition or subtraction.

standards.description: Solve addition and subtraction word problems and add and subtract within 10 by using objects or drawings to represent the problem.
standards.prompt_guide: Write a word problem using animals or toys involving simple addition or subtraction within 10.

standards.description: Decompose numbers less than or equal to 10 into pairs in more than one way by using objects or drawings and record each decomposition by a drawing or equation.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to find two different ways to make a number like 6 (e.g., 5+1, 3+3).

standards.description: For any number from 1 to 9, find the number that makes 10 when added to the given number by using objects or drawings and record the answer with a drawing or equation.
standards.prompt_guide: Provide a number like 4. Ask the student what number must be added to it to make 10.

standards.description: Fluently add and subtract within 5.
standards.prompt_guide: Create rapid-fire addition or subtraction problems using numbers 0-5.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Compose and decompose numbers from 11 to 19 using quantities (numbers with units) of ten ones and some further ones.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to show how a number like 14 is made of one ten and four ones.

standards.description: Describe measurable attributes (length, height, weight, width, depth) of an object or a set of objects using appropriate vocabulary.
standards.prompt_guide: Show an object (like a pencil) and ask the student to describe its length or weight using comparison words.

standards.description: Directly compare two objects with a measurable attribute in common, to see which object has 'more of'/'less of' the attribute and describe the difference.
standards.prompt_guide: Compare two items (e.g., a crayon and a marker). Ask which is longer or shorter.

standards.description: Classify and sort objects or people by attributes.
standards.prompt_guide: Provide a list of shapes or items. Ask the student to sort them into groups (e.g., by color or size).

standards.description: Recognize and identify coins by name (penny, nickel, dime, quarter).
standards.prompt_guide: Show images of coins. Ask the student to name them.

standards.description: Name and describe shapes in the environment.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to find an object in the room (or an image) that looks like a circle, square, or triangle.

standards.description: Correctly name shapes regardless of orientations or overall size.
standards.prompt_guide: Show shapes turned in different directions. Ask the student to identify them.

standards.description: Identify shapes as two-dimensional or three-dimensional.
standards.prompt_guide: Show a flat square and a cube. Ask the student to identify which is flat (2D) and which is solid (3D).

standards.description: Describe the similarities, differences and attributes of two and three dimensional shapes using different sizes and orientations.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to explain how a square is different from a rectangle or a cube.

standards.description: Model shapes in the world by building figures from components and drawing shapes.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to draw a house using simple shapes like squares and triangles.

standards.description: Compose simple shapes to form larger shapes.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to show how two triangles can make a square.

standards.description: Use addition and subtraction within 20 to solve word problems involving situations of adding to, taking from, putting together, taking apart and comparing.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a word problem involving counting toys or snacks where the total is less than 20.

standards.description: Solve word problems that call for addition of three whole numbers whose sum is less than or equal to 20.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a problem adding three numbers, like 3 + 4 + 2.

standards.description: Apply properties of operations as strategies to add and subtract.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a problem showing that 8 + 3 is the same as 3 + 8 (commutative property).

standards.description: Understand subtraction as an unknown-addend problem.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to solve 10 - 8 by finding what number added to 8 makes 10.

standards.description: Relate counting to addition and subtraction.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a task that uses counting on (e.g., start at 5 and count up 2) to solve addition.

standards.description: Add and subtract within 20.
standards.prompt_guide: Provide straightforward addition and subtraction problems with sums up to 20.

standards.description: Understand the meaning of the equal sign and determine if equations involving addition and subtraction are true or false.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask if an equation like 6 = 6 or 7 = 8 - 1 is true or false.

standards.description: Determine the unknown whole number in an addition or subtraction equation relating three whole numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a problem with a missing number, like 8 + ? = 11.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Count forward to and backward from 120, starting at any number less than 120.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to count starting from a number like 98 up to 105.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Understand that the two digits of a two-digit number represent amounts of tens and ones.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to identify how many tens and ones are in the number 34.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Compare two two-digit numbers based on meanings of the tens and ones digits, using >, =, and < symbols.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to compare 34 and 43 using <, >, or =.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Add within 100 including adding a two-digit number and a one-digit number, and adding a two-digit number and a multiple of 10.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a problem adding a two digit number (e.g., 45) and a one digit number (e.g., 4) or a ten (e.g., 10).

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Given a two-digit number, mentally find 10 more or 10 less than the number.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student what is 10 more than 23 without counting.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Subtract multiples of 10 in the range 10-90 from multiples of 10 in the range 10-90.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a problem like 70 - 30.

standards.description: Order three objects by length; compare the lengths of two objects indirectly by using a third object.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to order three drawn lines from shortest to longest.

standards.description: Express the length of an object as a whole number of same-size length units.
standards.prompt_guide: Show an object and a unit (like a paperclip) and ask how many units long the object is.

standards.description: Assign values to time and money; tell and write time in hours and half-hours; identify coins by values.
standards.prompt_guide: Show a clock face at 3:30 or ask the value of a dime.

standards.description: Investigate questions involving categorical data (pose questions, gather data, organize/represent data in a table/chart).
standards.prompt_guide: Provide a simple chart of favorite colors and ask a question about the data.

standards.description: Distinguish between defining attributes versus non-defining attributes; build and draw shapes to possess defining attributes.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to identify a triangle based on its number of sides, regardless of its color.

standards.description: Compose two-dimensional shapes or three-dimensional shapes to create a composite shape.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to combine two squares to make a rectangle.

standards.description: Partition circles and rectangles into two and four equal shares, describe the shares using halves, fourths and quarters.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to divide a circle into halves or fourths.

standards.description: Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve one- and two-step word problems.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a two-step word problem involving addition and subtraction with numbers up to 100.

standards.description: Fluently add and subtract within 20 using mental strategies.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a mental math problem for addition or subtraction within 20.

standards.description: Determine whether a group of objects (up to 20) has an odd or even number of members.
standards.prompt_guide: Provide a number (e.g., 14) and ask if it is odd or even.

standards.description: Use addition to find the total number of objects arranged in rectangular arrays with up to 5 rows and up to 5 columns.
standards.prompt_guide: Show a 3x4 array of dots and ask the student to write an addition equation to find the total.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Understand that the three digits of a three-digit number represent amounts of hundreds, tens and ones.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to break down 706 into hundreds, tens, and ones.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Count forwards and backwards within 1000; skip-count by 5s, 10s and 100s.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to count by 10s starting from 150.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Read and write numbers to 1000 using base-ten numerals, number names and expanded form.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to write 453 in expanded form (400 + 50 + 3).

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Compare two three-digit numbers based on meanings of the hundreds, tens and ones digits, using >, =, and < symbols.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to compare 567 and 576.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Fluently add and subtract within 100 using strategies based on place value.
standards.prompt_guide: Create an addition problem like 45 + 38 requiring regrouping.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Add up to four two-digit numbers using strategies based on place value.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a column addition problem with four numbers: 23 + 15 + 44 + 12.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Add and subtract within 1000 using concrete models, drawings, and strategies based on place value.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a large addition or subtraction problem, such as 450 + 275.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Mentally add 10 or 100 to a given number 100-900 and mentally subtract 10 or 100.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student what is 100 less than 845.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Explain why addition and subtraction strategies work, using place value and the properties of operations.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to explain how they solved 24 + 36.

standards.description: Measure the length of an object by selecting and using appropriate tool(s) to measure.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student which tool (ruler, yardstick) they would use to measure a pencil vs a table.

standards.description: Measure the length of an object twice, using length units of different lengths for the two measurements.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask how a measurement changes if you use inches versus centimeters.

standards.description: Estimate lengths using units of inches, feet, yards, centimeters and meters.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to estimate the length of a desk in feet.

standards.description: Measure to determine how much longer one object is than another.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to find the difference in length between two lines.

standards.description: Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve word problems involving lengths.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a word problem about adding two lengths together.

standards.description: Represent whole numbers as lengths from 0 on a number line.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to mark the number 55 on a number line that goes from 0 to 100.

standards.description: Tell and write time from analog and digital clocks to the nearest five minutes, using a.m. and p.m.
standards.prompt_guide: Show a clock face and ask the student to write the time, including AM or PM context.

standards.description: Solve word problems with adding and subtracting within 100 using money symbols.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a money problem involving dollars and cents.

standards.description: Investigate questions involving measurements (generate data, and show measurements by making a dot plot).
standards.prompt_guide: Provide a set of data points and ask the student to plot them on a line.

standards.description: Create a pictograph and a bar graph to represent a data set with up to four categories.
standards.prompt_guide: Provide data about favorite pets and ask the student to interpret a bar graph.

standards.description: Recognize and draw shapes having specified attributes, such as a given number of angles or sides.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to draw a hexagon and count its sides.

standards.description: Partition a rectangle into rows and columns of same-size squares and count to find the total number of them.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to calculate the area of a rectangle by counting grid squares.

standards.description: Partition circles and rectangles into two, three, or four equal shares.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to divide a circle into thirds.

standards.description: Interpret and demonstrate products of whole numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask the student to draw a picture representing 3 groups of 5 objects (3 x 5).

standards.description: Interpret and demonstrate whole-number quotients of whole numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a division problem sharing 12 cookies among 4 friends.

standards.description: Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve word problems.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a word problem involving multiplication or division.

standards.description: Determine the unknown whole number in a multiplication or division equation.
standards.prompt_guide: Solve for x: 4 x ? = 20.

standards.description: Apply properties of operations as strategies to multiply and divide.
standards.prompt_guide: Show how 2 x 4 x 5 can be easier if you multiply 2 x 5 first.

standards.description: Understand division as an unknown-factor problem.
standards.prompt_guide: Explain how 20 / 5 is the same as finding what times 5 equals 20.

standards.description: Fluently multiply and divide within 100.
standards.prompt_guide: Rapid fire multiplication facts (e.g., 7 x 8).

standards.description: Use various strategies to solve two-step word problems using the four operations.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a two-step problem involving addition and multiplication.

standards.description: Identify arithmetic patterns and explain them using properties of operations.
standards.prompt_guide: Ask why multiples of 2 are always even.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Use place value understanding to round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.
standards.prompt_guide: Round 346 to the nearest 10.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Fluently add and subtract within 1000.
standards.prompt_guide: Add 455 and 367.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Multiply one-digit whole numbers by multiples of 10 in the range of 10-90.
standards.prompt_guide: Solve 5 x 40.

standards.description: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts.
standards.prompt_guide: Draw a shape divided into equal parts and ask what fraction one part represents.

standards.description: Understand a fraction as a number on the number line; represent fractions on a number line.
standards.prompt_guide: Mark 1/3 on a number line from 0 to 1.

standards.description: Explain equivalence of fractions in special cases and compare by reasoning about their size.
standards.prompt_guide: Are 1/2 and 2/4 equivalent? Explain why with a drawing.

standards.description: Tell and write time to the nearest minute and measure elapsed time intervals in minutes.
standards.prompt_guide: If a movie starts at 3:15 and lasts 30 minutes, when does it end?

standards.description: Measure and solve problems involving mass and liquid volume.
standards.prompt_guide: Word problem involving liters or grams.

standards.description: Investigate questions involving categorical data (create scaled pictograph and scaled bar graph).
standards.prompt_guide: Interpret a bar graph where one square equals 5 votes.

standards.description: Investigate questions involving numerical data (generate measurement data by measuring lengths using rulers).
standards.prompt_guide: Measure lines to the nearest quarter inch.

standards.description: Recognize area as an attribute of plane figures and understand concepts of area measurement.
standards.prompt_guide: What is area? How do we measure it?

standards.description: Measure areas by counting unit squares.
standards.prompt_guide: Find the area of a shape on a grid by counting the boxes.

standards.description: Relate area to the operations of multiplication and addition.
standards.prompt_guide: Find the area of a rectangle with length 4 and width 3 using multiplication.

standards.description: Solve real world and mathematical problems involving perimeters of polygons.
standards.prompt_guide: Calculate the perimeter of a garden.

standards.description: Classify polygons by attributes.
standards.prompt_guide: Is a square a rectangle? Explain why.

standards.description: Partition shapes into parts with equal areas. Express the area of each part as a unit fraction of the whole.
standards.prompt_guide: Divide a shape into 4 equal parts and name the fraction for one part.

standards.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison.
standards.prompt_guide: Write an equation for: 35 is 5 times as many as 7.

standards.description: Multiply or divide to solve word problems involving multiplicative comparisons.
standards.prompt_guide: A blue hat costs $6. A red hat costs 3 times as much. How much is the red hat?

standards.description: Solve multistep word problems posed with whole numbers and having whole number answers using the four operations, including problems with remainders.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a multi-step word problem involving division with a remainder.

standards.description: Find factors and multiples of numbers in the range 1-100.
standards.prompt_guide: Find all factors of 24.

standards.description: Generate a number or shape pattern that follows a given rule.
standards.prompt_guide: Start at 3 and add 5. What are the next 3 numbers?

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Recognize in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents ten times what it represents in the place to its right.
standards.prompt_guide: How does the value of 5 compare in 500 versus 50?

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Represent and compare multi-digit whole numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Write 40,302 in expanded form.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Use place value understanding to round multi-digit whole numbers to any place.
standards.prompt_guide: Round 145,230 to the nearest thousand.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Fluently add and subtract multi-digit whole numbers using an algorithm.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Multiply whole numbers (up to four digit number by a one-digit number and two-digit number by two-digit number).
standards.prompt_guide: Multiply 34 x 26.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Divide up to four-digit dividends by one-digit divisors.
standards.prompt_guide: Divide 3450 by 5.

standards.description: Understand and generate equivalent fractions.
standards.prompt_guide: Find two equivalent fractions for 2/3.

standards.description: Compare two fractions with different numerators and different denominators.
standards.prompt_guide: Compare 3/4 and 5/8.

standards.description: Understand a fraction a/b with a > 1 as a sum of fractions 1/b.
standards.prompt_guide: Decompose 3/4 into a sum of unit fractions.

standards.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction by a whole number.
standards.prompt_guide: Calculate 5 x 1/3.

standards.description: Convert and add fractions with denominators of 10 and 100.
Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100.
standards.prompt_guide: Write 0.45 as a fraction.

standards.description: Compare two decimals to hundredths.
standards.prompt_guide: Compare 0.5 and 0.05.

standards.description: Know relative size of measurement units within one system of units.
standards.prompt_guide: Which is larger: 1 kg or 1 g?

standards.description: Use the four operations to solve word problems involving distances, intervals of time, liquid volumes, masses of objects and money.
standards.prompt_guide: Solve a word problem involving elapsed time.

standards.description: Apply the area and perimeter formulas for rectangles.
standards.prompt_guide: Find the perimeter of a rectangle with width 5 and length 8.

standards.description: Use dot plots to analyze data to a statistical question.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a question about a given dot plot.

standards.description: Recognize angles as geometric shapes and understand concepts of angle measurement.
standards.prompt_guide: Define an angle.

standards.description: Measure angles in whole-number degrees using a protractor.
standards.prompt_guide: Draw an angle and ask for its measurement in degrees.

standards.description: Recognize angle measure as additive.
standards.prompt_guide: If an angle is split into two parts of 30 and 40 degrees, what is the total angle?

standards.description: Draw points, lines, line segments, rays, angles (right, acute, obtuse) and perpendicular and parallel lines.
standards.prompt_guide: Draw a set of parallel lines.

standards.description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines.
standards.prompt_guide: Identify a right triangle.

standards.description: Identify lines of symmetry.
standards.prompt_guide: Draw a line of symmetry on a butterfly.

standards.description: Use parentheses, brackets or braces in numerical expressions and evaluate expressions.
standards.prompt_guide: Evaluate: 3 x (4 + 5).

standards.description: Write simple expressions with numbers and interpret numerical expressions without evaluating them.
standards.prompt_guide: Write the expression for 'add 8 and 7, then multiply by 2'.

standards.description: Generate numerical patterns for situations (generate rules, use tables/ordered pairs/graphs).
standards.prompt_guide: Create a pattern where y is always double x.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Recognize that in a multi-digit number, a digit in one place represents 10 times as much as it represents in the place to its right.
standards.prompt_guide: Compare the value of the digit 7 in 700 and 70.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Multiply and divide by powers of 10.
standards.prompt_guide: Calculate 4.5 x 100.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Read, write and compare decimals to thousandths.
standards.prompt_guide: Compare 3.456 and 3.465.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Use place value understanding to round decimals to any place.
standards.prompt_guide: Round 4.567 to the nearest hundredth.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Fluently multiply multi-digit whole numbers using an algorithm.
standards.prompt_guide: Multiply 123 x 45.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Divide up to four-digit dividends by two-digit divisors.
standards.prompt_guide: Divide 1200 by 25.

standards.domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
standards.description: Operations with decimals to hundredths (add, subtract, multiply and divide).
Efficiently add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators.
Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a word problem about cooking that requires adding fractions.

standards.description: Interpret a fraction as division of the numerator by the denominator.
standards.prompt_guide: Explain how 3/4 is the same as 3 divided by 4.

standards.description: Apply and extend previous understanding of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction.
standards.prompt_guide: Multiply 2/3 x 4/5.

standards.description: Interpret multiplication as scaling (resizing).
standards.prompt_guide: Explain why multiplying by 1/2 makes a number smaller.

standards.description: Solve real world problems involving multiplication of fractions and mixed numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Solve a word problem involving area with fractional side lengths.

standards.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of division to divide unit fractions by whole numbers and whole numbers by unit fractions.
standards.prompt_guide: Divide 1/2 by 3.

standards.description: Convert among different size measurement units within one system of units.
standards.prompt_guide: Convert 500 cm to meters.

standards.description: Identify and gather data for statistical questions focused on both categorical and numerical data.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a line plot from given data.

standards.description: Recognize volume as an attribute of solid figures and understand concepts of volume measurement.
standards.prompt_guide: What is volume?

standards.description: Measure volumes by counting unit cubic cm, cubic in, cubic ft.
standards.prompt_guide: Calculate volume by counting cubes.

standards.description: Relate volume to the operations of multiplication and addition and solve real world problems involving volume.
standards.prompt_guide: Find the volume of a rectangular prism.

standards.description: Use a pair perpendicular number lines, called axes, to define a coordinate system.
standards.prompt_guide: Plot (3, 4) on a coordinate plane.

standards.description: Represent real world and mathematical problems by graphing points in the first quadrant.
standards.prompt_guide: Graph the path of a character on a map grid.

standards.description: Understand that attributes belonging to a category of two dimensional figures also belong to all subcategories.
standards.prompt_guide: Why is a square also a rectangle?

standards.description: Classify two-dimensional figures in a hierarchy based on properties.
standards.prompt_guide: Classify quadrilaterals based on their properties.

standards.description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.
standards.prompt_guide: Write the ratio of apples to oranges if there are 3 apples and 2 oranges.

standards.description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b.
standards.prompt_guide: If a car travels 100 miles in 2 hours, what is the unit rate per hour?

standards.description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
standards.prompt_guide: Solve a problem about discounts or unit pricing.

standards.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions.
standards.prompt_guide: Divide 3/4 by 1/2.

standards.description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using an algorithm.
standards.prompt_guide: Divide 12,345 by 15.

standards.description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply and divide multi-digit decimals using an algorithm for each operation.
standards.prompt_guide: Multiply 3.14 by 2.5.

standards.description: Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1-100 with a common factor.
standards.prompt_guide: Factor out the greatest common factor from 24 + 36.

standards.description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values.
standards.prompt_guide: Describe a temperature drop of 5 degrees using negative numbers.

standards.description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line.
standards.prompt_guide: Plot -3 and 3 on a number line.

standards.description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Find the absolute value of -7.

standards.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane.
standards.prompt_guide: Plot points (2, -3) and (-2, 3) on a graph.

standards.description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole number exponents.
standards.prompt_guide: Evaluate 2 to the power of 3.

standards.description: Write, read and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.
standards.prompt_guide: Evaluate 3x + 4 when x = 5.

standards.description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.
standards.prompt_guide: Simplify 2(x + 3).

standards.description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent when the two expressions name the same number regardless of which value is substituted.
standards.prompt_guide: Are 2x + 4 and 2(x + 2) equivalent? Why?

standards.description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: which values make the equation true?
standards.prompt_guide: Find the value of x that makes 2x = 10 true.

standards.description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem.
standards.prompt_guide: Write an expression for '5 dollars more than the cost c'.

standards.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q.
standards.prompt_guide: Solve for x: x + 5 = 12.

standards.description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint.
standards.prompt_guide: Write an inequality for 'you must be older than 12 to ride'.

standards.description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that changes in relationship to one another.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a table showing the relationship between distance and time at constant speed.

standards.description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals and polygons.
standards.prompt_guide: Calculate the area of a triangle with base 4 and height 3.

standards.description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with rational number edge lengths.
standards.prompt_guide: Find the volume of a box with fractional dimensions.

standards.description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices.
standards.prompt_guide: Plot the vertices of a square on a graph.

standards.description: Classify three-dimensional figures including cubes, prisms, pyramids, cones and spheres.
standards.prompt_guide: Identify the difference between a prism and a pyramid.

standards.description: Apply the four-step investigative process for statistical reasoning.
standards.prompt_guide: Outline the steps to investigate a question like 'How tall are students in our class?'

standards.description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data.
standards.prompt_guide: Is 'How old am I?' a statistical question? Why or why not?

standards.description: Understand that a set of numerical data has a distribution described by its center, spread and overall shape.
standards.prompt_guide: Describe the shape of a given data distribution.

standards.description: Recognize that a measure of center summarizes all values with a single number.
standards.prompt_guide: Calculate the mean of a data set.

standards.description: Display the distribution of numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms and box plots.
standards.prompt_guide: Create a box plot for the given data.

standards.description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
standards.prompt_guide: Interpret the mean and median in the context of the data source.
